Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Prurient \Pru"ri*ent\, a. [L. pruries, -entis, p. pr. of prurire to itch. Cf. {Freeze}.] Uneasy with desire; itching; especially, having a lascivious curiosity or propensity; lustful. -- {Pru"ri*ent*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]
The eye of the vain and prurient is darting from object to object of illicit attraction. --I. Taylor. [1913 Webster]

prurient adj : characterized by lust; "eluding the lubricious embraces of her employer"; "her sensuous grace roused his lustful nature"; "prurient literature"; "prurient thoughts"; "a salacious rooster of a little man" [syn: {lubricious}, {lustful}, {salacious}]
